Det är också viktigt att man tar ansvar för sina arbetsuppgifter och söker effektivisering och förbättring inom sitt arbetsområde. Rätt kandidat har förmåga att se möjligheter till förbättringar. Väsentligt är att man har ett servicefokus och drivs av att arbeta med redovisning, system och processutveckling. Du är också kommunikativ och har lätt för att skapa goda relationer med olika kontaktytor internt och externt.
 



  





 Det är viktigt för oss att du identifierar dig med Fabeges gemensamma värdegrund, SPEAK. SPEAK står för nyckelorden Snabbhet, Prestigelöshet, Entreprenörskap, Affärsmässighet och Kundnärhet.
 



  





**Har vi väckt ditt intresse?** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Fabege med Mpya Finance. Vi ser fram emot att få din ansökan via mpyafinance.se så snart som möjligt. Har du frågor kring tjänsten kontakta ansvariga rekryteringskonsulter Helene Werme på
 **helene.werme@mpya.se** 
 eller Helén Lissäng på
 **helen.lissang@mpya.se** 
 . Intervjuer och urval kommer att ske löpande så skicka gärna in din ansökan snarast möjligt. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
 



  





**Om Fabege** 




 Fabege utvecklar trygga, attraktiva och hållbara stadsdelar i Stockholm. Med fokus på kommersiella fastigheter i ett antal välbelägna delmarknader skapar vi kontor, arbetsplatser och miljöer där människor mår bra och presterar bättre. Via dotterbolaget Birger Bostad tar vi ett ännu större grepp om helheten med bostadsutveckling i våra stadsdelar.

title: System Development Specialist
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**  

We are seeking a skilled and passionate System Development Specialist to support and enhance our production engineering team, ensuring the manufacturing and delivery of cutting-edge products and services.


Collaborate with a team of highly experienced and motivated professionals in an agile environment, working on innovative projects that drive digitalization and automation. If you are passionate about how and why things work the way they do, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity!

**How you’ll make an impact**

* Lead the system development of our purpose-built MES (Manufacturing Execution System), supporting end-to-end delivery and service processes.
* Be an integral part of the development team and apply state-of-the-art development methods to ensure smart and efficient implementation of new functionality.
* Drive the future of digitalization within our processes to enable automated and cost-efficient manufacturing.
* Serve as a backlog owner and release manager, overseeing updates and new features deployed directly into the production environment.
* Collaborate with business requirement owners and the global user community to define new features and contribute to continuous improvement.

**Your Background**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer science or Engineering, with a strong focus on software development.
* At least 5 years of experience in software and systems development or related fields.
* Proficiency in .NET, C#, VB6, Azure DevOps, SQL Server, and Visual Studio
* Experience in digitalization and automation, with the ability to document and lead implementation projects.
* Proficiency in English and Swedish is required
* Knowledge of SAP is a plus.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**

Are you ready for a new exciting challenge? Does the above description sound like you? Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today!


Recruiting manager Jonas Finell, jonas.finell@hitachienergy.com, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Klas Koppari, +46 107- 38 13 45; Unionen: Fredrik W Nordin, +46 107-38 15 12; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt +46 10 7387043. Any other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Antra Volujevica antra.volujevica@hitachienergy.com.

**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**

title: Devops Admin
description:
### **Din roll**


Som DevOps Administratör hos oss arbetar du som konsult och stöttar våra kunder med att bygga och förbättra deras DevOps-miljöer. Du ansvarar för att designa, administrera och optimera CI/CD-pipelines samtidigt som du skapar effektiva arbetsflöden i nära samarbete med utvecklingsteam. En viktig del av rollen är att hantera Git-repositorier och använda Infrastructure as Code (IaC) för att automatisera och förenkla processer.


Du kommer också att arbeta med modern containerteknologi och orkestreringslösningar som säkerställer skalbara och hållbara system. Utöver det får du arbeta med monitorering, analys och optimering av prestanda för att kontinuerligt förbättra CI/CD-livscykeln.


Med varierande projekt och uppdrag kommer du att få insikt i olika branscher och tekniska miljöer, vilket ger dig en unik möjlighet att utvecklas och bredda din kompetens.

### **Vem är du?**


Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av:

* Mjukvaruutveckling och automation med **Python**.
* Administrera och optimera **CI/CD-pipelines**, med förståelse för arkitektur.
* Git repository management, Git workflows och branchingstrategier.
* Infrastructure as Code (IaC) och att sätta upp pipelines med verktyg som exempelvis **Terraform** eller liknande.
* Konfigurationshantering med verktyg som **Ansible**, **Puppet**, **Chef** eller liknande.
* Containerlösningar som **Docker** och orkestrering med **Kubernetes**.
* Monitoreringslösningar samt typer av metrics användbara i CI/CD-flöden.
* God förståelse för grundläggande cloud concept.
* Du behöver vara flytande i engelska och svenska.

### **Meriterande erfarenheter**


Det är extra meriterande om du:

* Har erfarenhet av **Golang-programmering**.
* Har arbetat med CI/CD-automationsflöden som inkluderat egen hårdvara, till exempel egengjorda testriggar.

### **Varför Knowit?**


På Knowit Connectivity får du möjlighet att arbeta i en innovativ och lärande miljö där du kontinuerligt utvecklas. Vi kombinerar teknik och kreativitet för att skapa värde för våra kunder och samhället. Som konsult hos oss blir du en del av ett kompetent team som brinner för samarbete, delning av kunskap och att lösa spännande tekniska utmaningar.


Vill du veta mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss? Besök vår hemsida eller kontakta oss direkt!

### **Låter detta som en roll för dig?**


Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig och diskutera hur du kan bli en del av vårt team.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 300+ amazing people who work here.**

**Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.**


We are looking for a **DevOps Engineer**! Our Infrastructure team is now searching for a competent and dedicated DevOps Engineer. Our team is responsible for building, maintaining and supporting a scalable platform for all products at Sambla Group. As a DevOps Engineer you will help us maintain our deployment pipelines, databases, and entire AWS infrastructure for several products.


Amongst other things, you will work with:

* Designing, maintaining and developing the CI/CD pipelines
* Ensuring the platform availability, scalability and effectiveness throughout
* Continuing to further develop the security of our processes and systems
* For this position, we see that you have at least a couple years of working experience in the DevOps field. You should thrive in an atmosphere that puts focus on commitment and responsibility, and you should have a passion to deliver value and find solutions.


Must have experience for this position:

* Cloud (preferably AWS), Docker, Infrastructure as Code(preferably CloudFormation)
* Hands-on experience in Cloud security
* Experience with monitoring and logging tools, and networking

  

A bit of extra credit if you also have:

* Node/Javascript experience
* Knowledge in Cloud Governance, and Compliance
* An AWS Certification

**What we offer:**

* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
* We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
* A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.  

  

Please note!
  

As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.

title: Test Engineer – Battery / Swedish / Huskvarna
description:
**Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a**  

  

  

  

**Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our**

**About VIPAS :**


Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.

**Job Description:**


Husqvarna AB is currently looking for a **Test Engineer – Battery** to join our skilled team in Huskvarna.


In this role, you will work hands-on in the lab to conduct testing at both the component and product levels to verify mechanical and electronic functionality. Your responsibilities will include developing and executing verification plans, writing test protocols, and compiling reports to document results and perform detailed analyses.


You will also collaborate with R&D teams, OEM suppliers, and production units to improve our testing methodologies and processes, ensuring increased efficiency and accuracy.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Perform functional tests on battery-powered electronic components and systems
* Document results through test protocols and analytical reports
* Develop and execute verification and validation plans
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure product compliance with customer specifications
* Contribute to continuous improvement of testing methods and lab processes

  

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering (Electronics or Mechanics)
* Strong hands-on experience with mechanical and electronic function measurements
* Proven ability to communicate findings based on data ("fact-based" communication) with internal stakeholders and OEM suppliers
* Broad technical understanding of electrical integration and battery-driven product systems
* Proficient in both Swedish and English (spoken and written)
* Analytical, structured, and solution-oriented mindset
* Strong customer focus with the ability to translate real-world problems into robust technical solutions
* Team player with excellent communication skills

  

**Why Join Us?**



Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.


You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!


Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at swathianantu@vipas.se


Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.

 **How to Apply:**


Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!

  

Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Senior CI/CD Engineer
description:
**Är du en cloud engineer som vill ta nästa steg i din karriär?**


Vi på Knowit letar efter skickliga cloud engineers som vill utvecklas och vara med och driva molnutvecklingen i Norden. Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta med spännande kunder, bygga smarta lösningar och växa i din roll.

### **Vad kommer du att göra?**


Som cloud engineer hos oss kommer du att arbeta med att utveckla och hantera molnlösningar för olika kunder. Det kan handla om allt från att bygga CI/CD-pipelines till att sätta upp nya molnmiljöer. Vi jobbar alltid i team, så även om du inte har erfarenhet av alla delar är du ändå välkommen att söka.


Just nu letar vi särskilt efter personer med erfarenhet av **Azure eller AWS**, men om du är expert på privata eller on-prem-lösningar vill vi också höra från dig!

### **Vem är du?**


Vi tror att du har erfarenhet av några av följande områden:

* DevOps-metoder (t.ex. Infrastructure as Code, CI/CD-pipelines, versionering, övervakning)
* Publika moln och dess tjänster (främst **Azure eller AWS**)
* Containerbaserade lösningar (t.ex. **Docker, Kubernetes, EKS, ECS**)
* Automatisering med moderna verktyg och språk (t.ex. **Python, AWS Lambda, Azure Functions**)
* Minst **3 års erfarenhet av molnlösningar**


Vi ser det som ett plus om du även är intresserad av:

* **Cyber security**
* **Systemutveckling** (t.ex. Java, .NET, Rust, Go, Swift, C++)


Du behöver ha god kommunikativ förmåga och gilla att arbeta både praktiskt och strategiskt.

### **Om oss**


På Knowit får du chansen att utvecklas genom utmanande uppdrag och en positiv arbetsmiljö. Vi har en snabb, rolig och inspirerande arbetsplats där vi hjälper varandra att lyckas. Vi tror på öppenhet, samarbete och respekt – både gentemot våra kunder och varandra.


Våra projekt spänner över spännande områden som **självkörande bilar, infotainmentsystem och 5G**. Vi har expertis inom **embedded, cloud och applikationsutveckling**.

### **Ansökan**


Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt! Glöm inte att bifoga minst **tre cloud-projekt** du har arbetat med i ditt CV.


Har du frågor? Kontakta vår rekryterare **David Blaag Nilsson** på **david.blaag-nilsson@knowit.se**.

title: Senior Systemarkitekt
description:
**Har du gedigen erfarenhet av automation och systemarkitektur och trivs i rollen som teknisk ledare? Då kan detta vara rätt uppdrag för dig.**


Vi söker en mycket erfaren konsult som vill ta ett helhetsgrepp om systemarkitektur och leda ett mjukvaruteam inom ett större teknikskifte för styrsystem och datainsamling (HETS). Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i ett utvecklingsprojekt där ett äldre Siemens-baserat styrsystem ersätts med Beckhoff-teknologi.

### **Om rollen**


Som systemarkitekt kommer du att ansvara för att ta fram en komplett arkitektur som omfattar allt från mjukvara och hårdvara till PLC, HMI och databaskopplingar. Rollen innebär ett stort ansvar både strategiskt och operativt, där du guidar utvecklingsarbetet framåt och stöttar teamet i tekniska beslut och lösningar.


Du arbetar nära produktionen och säkerställer smidiga integrationer mot befintliga maskiner. Det krävs ett lösningsorienterat arbetssätt och djup teknisk kompetens, särskilt inom CE-märkning, funktionell säkerhet och felsökning i komplexa miljöer.

### **Kvalifikationer**


Minst 15 års erfarenhet inom industriell automation, programmering och styrsystem  

Dokumenterad bakgrund inom systemarkitektur, gärna från maskin- eller riggutvecklingsprojekt  

Djup kunskap om PLC-programmering och drift av industriella automationslösningar  

Erfarenhet av att leda mjukvaruteam i utvecklingsprojekt  

Kunskap om CE-märkning, riskanalyser (t.ex. CEDOC) och funktionell säkerhet (Sistema)  

Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt

### **Teknisk miljö**

**PLC-system:** Siemens (S5, S7, Safety, Technology), Beckhoff (TwinCAT 2/3, Safety, NC, HMI), Mitsubishi, Unitronics, ABB/Pluto  

**HMI:** Beijer (IX Developer, E-designer), IBH Softtec  

**Programmering:** Visual Basic 6, C++, C#, IEC 61131 (LD, SFC, FBD, ST, CFC), Siemens Graph, STL  

**Verktyg:** TIA Portal, Simatic Manager, S5/S7 for Windows, WinCC, ProTool, Siemens Logo, Visual Studio (2006–2020), GitHub, Azure DevOps, Subversion, EPLAN, Microsoft Project  

**Säkerhet och analys:** Sistema, CEDOC


Detta är ett uppdrag för dig som vill kombinera praktiskt ingenjörsarbete med strategisk systemdesign – och som vill göra skillnad i ett tekniskt avancerat och utvecklande projekt.

**Om Rasulson Consulting**

Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: DevOps Engineer - Ansible
description:
OM INFINITY IT CONSULTING: Infinity IT Consulting är ett konsultföretag inom IT och Management med en stark företagskultur och teamkänsla. Ditt välmående är vår framgång och vi menar att de bästa konsultaffärerna blir av och genomförs med stolthet när du som medarbetare mår som bäst, så gör även företaget och våra kunder det. Vi jobbar med IT-kunder och partners i hela Skandinavien inom både telekom, verkstadsindustrin, retail, sport & mode och många andra. Vi bygger teamet utifrån våra värderingar som genomsyrar hela företaget. Pannben – Viljan och förmågan att lösa uppgiften, ta ansvar och känna ägarskap, men alltid våga ta hjälp. Enkelhet – Vi krånglar inte till det, varken för oss själva eller för andra! Sunt förnuft och kundnöjdhet i fokus. Laganda – Vi ställer upp för varandra, gör varandra bättre och skrattar varje dag! Långsiktighet – Vi är besatta av att göra bra saker och saker bra, vi låter kortsiktiga vinningar stå tillbaka för långvariga affärsrelationer. Stolthet – Vi är rakryggade, på riktigt och vågar gå vår egen väg! Din IT-karriär kan starta hos just oss och vi ger förutsättningarna för det, eller så är du senior med många års erfarenhet och då ger vi utrymme för allt leda, kompetensutveckla och ge stöd åt våra mer juniora konsulter, och på det viset har vi en härlig mix i konsultteamet av olika utbyten i erfarenhet, intressen och kompetens.### **Vi söker en DevOps Engineer – Ansible**



Är du en självgående och proaktiv DevOps Engineer med djup kompetens inom Ansible och automation? Då kan det här vara rätt uppdrag för dig. Vi på Infinity söker nu en erfaren konsult till ett spännande uppdrag hos vår kund i Stockholm.


#### **Om uppdraget**



I rollen som DevOps Engineer kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att möjliggöra automation över hela Vattenfalls IT-landskap, med särskilt fokus på Ansible och AAP (Ansible Automation Platform). Du kommer att arbeta nära interna team för att omvandla deras behov till automatiserade lösningar samt bidra med din expertis kring bästa praxis och ramverk för automation.


#### **Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**


* Utveckla och implementera automation use cases med hjälp av AAP
* Bygga pipelines, hantera deployment och övervakning av tjänster
* Rådgiva kring automationsstrategier, verktyg och ramverk
* Samarbeta med interna team för att identifiera och automatisera deras behov

#### **Vi söker dig som har:**


* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av utveckling med Ansible
* Gedigen kunskap i YALM för konfigurations- och automationsarbete
* Starka kunskaper i skriptspråk som Python (föredras), Bash eller PowerShell
* Förmåga att både lära och lära ut i ett tvärfunktionellt och multikulturellt team
* Affärsmässig nivå i engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt
* En självgående och lösningsorienterad inställning

#### **Meriterande erfarenheter:**


* Generell erfarenhet av serveradministration (t.ex. mjukvaruinstallationer, konfigurationsändringar)
* Erfarenhet av verktyg som Saltstack, Git, Artifactory eller vRealize

#### **Om oss**



Vi är ett personligt IT-konsultbolag med fokus på långsiktiga relationer – både med våra kunder och konsulter. Vi erbjuder uppdrag som gör skillnad, och där du får möjlighet att utvecklas tillsammans med erfarna kollegor.



Vill du veta mer om uppdraget? Skicka in din ansökan eller hör av dig till oss direkt – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Scrum Master & Agile Delivery Lead
description:
At Telia, we’re proud to be at the forefront of the Big Data revolution. By leveraging the latest analytics tools and agile practices, we continuously enhance our offerings and deliver exceptional service and support. To help propel us further, we’re looking for a results-driven Scrum Master & Agile Delivery Lead to join our team. This is a unique opportunity to lead, inspire, and shape the delivery of modern, data-driven solutions in a fast-paced and transformative environment.


My name is Ravi Naramsetty, heading Martech IT for Telia Sweden. I am looking for a talented and driven Scrum Master with strong delivery experience to join my Agile MarTech team.


**As a Scrum Master & Agile Delivery Lead…**

You will be responsible for ensuring smooth and efficient delivery of products and services across agile teams. You will take a hands-on role in leading PI Planning sessions, facilitating roadmap check-ins, retrospectives, sprint planning, reviews, and daily stand-ups. Your mission will be to ensure alignment with business objectives, identify and resolve blockers, and guide the team toward continuous improvement and innovation. You will also coach agile teams, support conflict resolution, and foster a high-performing culture based on collaboration, transparency, and servant leadership. Working closely with stakeholders, you’ll challenge existing ways of working, help evolve delivery methods, and promote modern engineering practices including DevOps, test automation, and CI/CD. Your role will also include tracking and reporting on agile performance metrics and supporting business alignment throughout the delivery lifecycle.


**Who We’re Looking For…**

You have at least 7 years of experience in project or delivery management, with 3 or more years in Agile environments. You’re confident working across Agile frameworks like Scrum, Kanban, and SAFe, and have a solid understanding of the software development lifecycle, including DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines. You bring strong facilitation skills, emotional intelligence, and the ability to align teams and stakeholders around shared goals. Fluency in English is required, and Swedish is a plus.


What Sets You Apart:


* Hands-on experience leading teams in a SAFe environment
* Proficiency in tools like Jira and Confluence
* Experience in telecom or MarTech is a strong advantage

**We are more than a workplace**

Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn an annual bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.


**Ready to make better happen?**

We are looking forward to your application by 2025-05-01. If you are selected for the next stage in the process, you'll be contacted by our Hiring Manager/Talent Acquisition Partner. Required controls will be performed.


If you want to know more about this position, please contact me Ravi Kumar Naramsetty at ravi.naramsetty@teliacompany.com .


**Join us and let’s make better happen – together!**

Telia Company
Mall of Scandinavia

Stockholm
Sverige

title: Consultant Software Engineering
description:
#### **Welcome**


As part of the founding team in Gothenburg, you will play a key role in building up our presence in Sweden. Together with a small, dedicated team, you will actively help establish INVENSITY as a trusted engineering consultancy in the Scandinavian market. **You’ll operate with the freedom and mindset of a startup – backed by the expertise and structure of a global company.**

#### **What can you expect?**

* Support the development cycle of **complex software systems** in the areas from **requirements to software testing**
* **Optimize and automate workflows:** Design, model and evaluate software development processes and test and improve the **quality of software.** This is how you design software solutions efficiently and innovatively!
* **Create change:** Develop future-oriented concepts and software solutions, drive technology trends and play a key role in shaping progress in various industries
* Be part of the INVENSITY success story: Be part of building up **INVENSITY’s business in Sweden** and work in professional and international software teams
* **Share and expand your technical know-how:** Get onboarded to global organization's center of excellence and collaborate with technical experts in your area

#### **Your profile**

* Degree in **Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Data Science, Software Engineering** or a related field
* experience in software development, using one or more of the following programming languages: **C, C++, Java, JavaScript, Python, Matlab/Simulink**. Experience in embedded software development is a strong plus
* Familiarity with cloud platforms such as **GCP, Azure DevOps** or **AWS** is a plus
* Passion for designing and developing **complex software systems**
* Interest in **software and safety engineering**, process management, method development, software project management, **cloud solutions** or data solutions
* Comfortable working in dynamic environments, with a strong desire to contribute to the **growth of a new location** and be part of a **global team**
* Business fluent in Swedish and fluent in English

#### **What are your benefits?**

* **Welcome to the team!** So that you can hit the ground running right from the start, we will support you with a structured onboarding program together with other new starters
* **Steep learning curve through varied tasks** in an innovative environment with diverse projects in different industries and with different customers
* **Personal and professional development** through individual mentoring and coaching, ACADEMY training and a feedback culture
* **Unique atmosphere and appreciative Start-Up culture** through monthly events, fast communication channels and working towards common goals
* **Global network** through collaboration with experts at our international locations
* **Work-life balance** through permanent employment contracts, individual working time models in full or part-time, flexible working hours, home office option and sabbaticals
* **Attractive promotion opportunities** thanks to transparent career paths including rapid assumption of responsible tasks and international career opportunities
* **Performance-related remuneration package** with fixed and variable components and semi-annual assessments with salary increases

#### **Good to know**


Type of position: Permanent position, full-time, unlimited  

Place of work: hybrid

#### **Your contact person**


Sinja Seyfert (HR Consultant)  

sinja.seyfert@invensity.com  

+49 172 624 714 6

#### **About us**


Passion meets innovation - your chance at INVENSITY! Would you like to work for an international technology and innovation consultancy and develop your skills in a creative, team-oriented and appreciative working environment? There are no limits for you at INVENSITY!  

  

We work with innovative companies from all high-tech sectors. Our customers come from areas such as optical technologies, automotive and rail, aerospace, medical technology and life sciences, energy and utilities, defense, telecommunications and electronics. We support our clients with customized solutions to technological challenges throughout the development process, taking on both strategic consulting roles and operational activities.  

  

Learn more about INVENSITY, our offices and how we work at https://www.invensity.com/career.
company_description: Die INVENSITY GmbH ist eine internationale Technologie- und Innovationsberatung.  Wir gewähren Spitzenleistungen für Unternehmen im Forschungs- und Entwicklungsbereich.

title: Senior Systemarkitekt
description:
Har du gedigen erfarenhet av automation och systemarkitektur och trivs i rollen som teknisk ledare? Då kan detta vara rätt uppdrag för dig.
  
Vi söker en mycket erfaren konsult som vill ta ett helhetsgrepp om systemarkitektur och leda ett mjukvaruteam inom ett större teknikskifte för styrsystem och datainsamling (HETS). Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i ett utvecklingsprojekt där ett äldre Siemens-baserat styrsystem ersätts med Beckhoff-teknologi.
  
  

Om rollen
  
Som systemarkitekt kommer du att ansvara för att ta fram en komplett arkitektur som omfattar allt från mjukvara och hårdvara till PLC, HMI och databaskopplingar. Rollen innebär ett stort ansvar både strategiskt och operativt, där du guidar utvecklingsarbetet framåt och stöttar teamet i tekniska beslut och lösningar.
  
Du arbetar nära produktionen och säkerställer smidiga integrationer mot befintliga maskiner. Det krävs ett lösningsorienterat arbetssätt och djup teknisk kompetens, särskilt inom CE-märkning, funktionell säkerhet och felsökning i komplexa miljöer.
  
  

Kvalifikationer
  
✔ Minst 15 års erfarenhet inom industriell automation, programmering och styrsystem
  
✔ Dokumenterad bakgrund inom systemarkitektur, gärna från maskin- eller riggutvecklingsprojekt
  
✔ Djup kunskap om PLC-programmering och drift av industriella automationslösningar
  
✔ Erfarenhet av att leda mjukvaruteam i utvecklingsprojekt
  
✔ Kunskap om CE-märkning, riskanalyser (t.ex. CEDOC) och funktionell säkerhet (Sistema)
  
✔ Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt
  
Teknisk miljö
  
**PLC-system:** Siemens (S5, S7, Safety, Technology), Beckhoff (TwinCAT 2/3, Safety, NC, HMI), Mitsubishi, Unitronics, ABB/Pluto
  
**HMI:** Beijer (IX Developer, E-designer), IBH Softtec
  
**Programmering:** Visual Basic 6, C++, C#, IEC 61131 (LD, SFC, FBD, ST, CFC), Siemens Graph, STL
  
**Verktyg:** TIA Portal, Simatic Manager, S5/S7 for Windows, WinCC, ProTool, Siemens Logo, Visual Studio (2006–2020), GitHub, Azure DevOps, Subversion, EPLAN, Microsoft Project
  
**Säkerhet och analys:** Sistema, CEDOC
  
Detta är ett uppdrag för dig som vill kombinera praktiskt ingenjörsarbete med strategisk systemdesign – och som vill göra skillnad i ett tekniskt avancerat och utvecklande projekt.
  
Om Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
Are you a dynamic leader passionate about technology and eager for a career opportunity that promises substantial growth? Are you interested in leading our efforts to help every student in the world make one of the most critical decisions in their life, namely their ideal study program?
  
If so, look no further than Keystone Education Group. We seek an exceptional Engineering Manager to join us on this incredible journey. In this pivotal role, you will champion teams of both junior and senior full-stack developers, guiding them towards unparalleled success. With formal managerial responsibilities and crucial technical involvement with the Product team, you will be at the forefront of the technological innovation that drives our business.
  
We are searching for a leader with at least five years of experience leading development teams, handling personnel responsibilities, and recruiting, along with five years of hands-on experience as a full-stack developer. The perfect candidate should have a passion for tech development, be team-oriented, and have a track record of delivering extraordinary results. Proficiency with modern web application development technologies and frameworks is non-negotiable.
  
At Keystone, we foster a supportive environment that promotes growth and learning. You will be free to make impactful decisions within a rapidly expanding company, access to extensive training and learning opportunities, and collaborate with an international team. Moreover, we provide space for initiatives and ideas alongside various team activities and events that cultivate a collaborative work culture.
  
Our engineering team at Keystone crafts the products that propel our business, and we are looking for exceptional individuals to join us during this period of rapid growth. As a member of our family, you will work within a vibrant, international community based in Stockholm, encountering exciting prospects and interesting challenges daily. We emphasise continuous development and learning, both internally and externally, and we are committed to providing an environment that promotes autonomy and empowerment.
  
To add to the appeal, you will have the opportunity to be mentored by leaders who have spearheaded massive teams and tackled the most demanding challenges with tech and education industry giants. If you are ready to take on a new challenge, make impactful contributions, and grow with us, seize the opportunity by clicking the "Apply here!" button to submit your application.
  
  

**Technologies we are working with:**  

**Backend technology:** .NET, xUnit
  
**Frontend technology:** React / Next.js, MUI, JEST
  
**Cloud providers:** AWS
  
**Data management technologies:** Postgres, DynamoDB, Redis, Elasticsearch
  
**DevOps:** IaC (CDK), GitHub, AWS Amplify
  
  

What can we offer you?
  
Freedom to help, plan and lead system architecture decisions in a fast-growing company.
  
Extensive training and learning opportunities.
  
Flexible hybrid work arrangements. An international work environment with colleagues from different nationalities.
  
Autonomy and empowerment to pursue initiatives and ideas.
  
Learn and educate through seminars at relevant conferences in Stockholm, or during our Hackathon events.
  
Monday breakfast regular team lunches, Tech academy, Friday beer team activities and fun events.
  
  

**About the team:**  

The tech team works as an in-house tech department, based out in Stockholm. The responsibilities of the team encompass developing technical platforms and solutions to lay the ground for the rest of the business at Keystone Education Group. We are a rapidly growing company that is now looking for new talents to strengthen our team. Read more about us here: https://www.keg.com/ .
  
Do you want to join our family? Please send us your application by hitting the button "Apply here!". We are looking for someone who can start as soon as possible in our Stockholm office.
  
Keystone is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are deeply committed to fostering an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Associate Cloud Operations Architect, EU-North (EMEA)
description:
- Experience in a similar role as a Technical Account Manager, Consultant, Solutions Architect, Platform Engineer, Systems Engineer, Cloud Architect etc. · Understand operational parameters and troubleshooting for four (2) of the following: Compute / Storage / Networking / CDN / Databases / DevOps / Big Data and Analytics / Security / Architecture / Applications Development in a distributed systems environment · External customer-facing experience with the ability to clearly articulate to small and large audiences · Ability to juggle tasks and projects in a fast-paced environment
  

Would you like to join one of the fastest-growing organizations within Amazon Web Services (AWS), and help customers of all industries and sizes gain the best value and service from AWS? Cloud Operations Architects (COA) drive our customers’ creative and transformative spirit of innovation across all technologies - including Compute, Storage, Database, Big Data, Application-level Services, Networking, Serverless, Deployment, Security and more. This is not a sales role, but rather an opportunity to be the principal technical advisor and ‘voice of the customer’ to organizations ranging from start-ups to large enterprises in commercial and public sector.
The Role
As a Associate COA, you will help craft and execute on defined strategies to drive our customers’ adoption and use of AWS services - including EC2, S3, DynamoDB & RDS databases, Lambda, CloudFront CDN, IoT, and many more. Your technical appetite to learn and customer-facing skills will enable you to effectively represent AWS within a customer’s environment, and drive customer initiatives working closely with leadership regarding incidents, trade-offs, support, and risk management.
You will provide advocacy and participate in strategic technical guidance to help customers plan and build solutions using best practices, and proactively keep your customers’ AWS environments operationally healthy. The close relationships developed with your customers will allow you to understand their business/operational needs and technical challenges, and help them achieve the greatest value from AWS. This position will require the ability to travel 10% or more as needed.
The Associate COA is the centerpiece of value to our Enterprise Support customers. If you wish to be at the forefront of innovation, come join us!
AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success.
Key job responsibilities
You’ll advise on solutions, provide technical guidance and advocate for the customer
\* Ensure AWS environments remain operationally healthy whilst reducing cost and complexity
\* Develop trusting relationships with customers, understanding their business needs and technical challenges
\* Using your technical acumen and customer obsession, you’ll drive technical discussions regarding incidents, trade-offs, and risk management
\* Consult with a range of partners from developers through to C-suite executives
\* Collaborate with AWS Solutions Architects, Business Developers, Professional Services Consultants, and Sales Account Managers
\* With a bias for action, you'll proactively find opportunities for customers to gain additional value from AWS
\* Provide detailed reviews of service events, monthly & quarterly metrics, detailed pre-launch planning
\* Solve a variety of problems across different customers as they migrate their workloads to the cloud
A day in the life
See what the team say about similar roles;
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M7j83fWoqmQ
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l48WpOmM5j4
About the team
Diverse Experiences 
Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS 
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Work/Life Balance 
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
Inclusive Team Culture 
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
Mentorship and Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
  

* Professional experience with AWS and/or other cloud offerings such as Azure, Google Cloud Platform etc. Programming or scripting skills with a combination of Java, Python Perl, Ruby, C#, and/or PHP Previous experience as a Software Engineer, Developer, Solution Architect, DevOps Engineer, etc. Understanding of DevOps practices and tools, including: Continuous Integration / Deployment, Puppet, Docker, Kubernetes, Chef etc.

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
company_description: Amazon Web Services (AWS) offers the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform, with over 200 powerful services that enable our customers and our people to make more of an impact.

title: SYSADMIN (WINDOWS) TILL STOCKHOLM!
description:
Sigma Technology* All open positions
* Open Positions details
**JOB DESCRIPTION**
-------------------


Sigma Technology IT Infra AB växer så det knakar i Stockholm och nu söker vi en ny kollega till ett spännande uppdrag hos vår stora kund i Järfälla! Har du ett genuint intresse för teknik och Windows-miljöer? Vill du arbeta i en roll där du får utveckla och förvalta serverplattformar i en spännande och säkerhetskritisk miljö? Då kan detta vara rätt möjlighet för dig!

  

Du kommer att bli anställd av oss på Sigma Technology och ingå i ett härligt konsultteam som gör saker tillsammans och har roligt längs vägen! Ibland åker vi utomlands och ibland pustar vi ut på en trevlig afterwork tillsammans. Vi sätter dig som konsult i fokus, det viktigaste för oss är att du som konsult och medarbetare mår bra och har rätt förutsättningar för att utvecklas. Vi tror på långsiktighet och vill därför att du ska trivas hos oss, länge! Vi på Sigma Technology är otroligt stolta över att våra medarbetare har röstat fram oss hela **12 år i rad** bland Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare. I Topp-4 har vi legat under åren 2019-2023 och med stor glädje blev vi framröstade **2024 till Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsgivare!**

***Om rollen och uppdraget***  

Din roll kommer att vara systemförvaltare i vår kunds DevOps-team, där du tillsammans med engagerade kollegor ansvarar för utveckling och förvaltning av vår kunds Windows-miljöer och applikationer. Dina huvudsakliga uppgifter inkluderar:


✔️ Applikationspaketering (MSI, App Volume, SCCM)  

✔️ Arbeta med MECM/SCCM  

✔️ Hantering av Horizon VDI-miljö  

✔️ Förvaltning av Windows- och VDI-plattformar  

  

Vem är du?  

Vi tror att du har några års erfarenhet inom Windows Server och klienthantering samt ett stort teknikintresse. Du har goda kunskaper i PowerShell och gillar att arbeta i en miljö där IT-säkerhet är en viktig del av vardagen. För att lyckas i rollen behöver du även vara lösningsorienterad, självgående och ha en god kommunikativ förmåga på både svenska och engelska.

  

Meriterande erfarenheter:  

 Horizon  

 SCCM  

 Microsoft standardprodukter (Active Directory, DNS, WDS)  

 Applikationspaketering

  

Låter det som ett uppdrag för dig? Vi bearbetar ansökningar löpande, så vänta inte med din ansökan! Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Sysadmin (Windows) till Stockholm!
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Sigma Technology IT Infra AB växer så det knakar i Stockholm och nu söker vi en ny kollega till ett spännande uppdrag hos vår stora kund i Järfälla! Har du ett genuint intresse för teknik och Windows-miljöer? Vill du arbeta i en roll där du får utveckla och förvalta serverplattformar i en spännande och säkerhetskritisk miljö? Då kan detta vara rätt möjlighet för dig!



Du kommer att bli anställd av oss på Sigma Technology och ingå i ett härligt konsultteam som gör saker tillsammans och har roligt längs vägen! Ibland åker vi utomlands och ibland pustar vi ut på en trevlig afterwork tillsammans. Vi sätter dig som konsult i fokus, det viktigaste för oss är att du som konsult och medarbetare mår bra och har rätt förutsättningar för att utvecklas. Vi tror på långsiktighet och vill därför att du ska trivas hos oss, länge! Vi på Sigma Technology är otroligt stolta över att våra medarbetare har röstat fram oss hela **12 år i rad** bland Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare. I Topp-4 har vi legat under åren 2019-2023 och med stor glädje blev vi framröstade **2024 till Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsgivare!**



***Om rollen och uppdraget***  

Din roll kommer att vara systemförvaltare i vår kunds DevOps-team, där du tillsammans med engagerade kollegor ansvarar för utveckling och förvaltning av vår kunds Windows-miljöer och applikationer. Dina huvudsakliga uppgifter inkluderar:



✔️ Applikationspaketering (MSI, App Volume, SCCM)  

✔️ Arbeta med MECM/SCCM  

✔️ Hantering av Horizon VDI-miljö  

✔️ Förvaltning av Windows- och VDI-plattformar



Vem är du?  

Vi tror att du har några års erfarenhet inom Windows Server och klienthantering samt ett stort teknikintresse. Du har goda kunskaper i PowerShell och gillar att arbeta i en miljö där IT-säkerhet är en viktig del av vardagen. För att lyckas i rollen behöver du även vara lösningsorienterad, självgående och ha en god kommunikativ förmåga på både svenska och engelska.



Meriterande erfarenheter:  

 Horizon  

 SCCM  

 Microsoft standardprodukter (Active Directory, DNS, WDS)  

 Applikationspaketering



Låter det som ett uppdrag för dig? Vi bearbetar ansökningar löpande, så vänta inte med din ansökan! Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!


### **MORE INFORMATION**

  



Elena Hallin  

elena.hallin@sigmatechnology.com



* #### **POSITION**


Sysadmin (Windows) till Stockholm!
* #### **COMPANY**


Sigma Technology IT Infra
* #### **LOCATION**


Stockholm, Sweden
* #### **COMPETENCE AREA**


Operation, support and infrastructure
* #### **PUBLICATION DATE**


2025-04-22
* #### **CONTACT**


Elena Hallin, elena.hallin@sigmatechnology.com, +46790742946

title: Senior QA/Testautomatiserare
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Är du en erfaren QA-specialist och testautomatiserare som är redo för nya utmaningar? Vi vill gärna ta del av din expertis, och dela med oss av vår i en rolig arbetsvardag. Vi söker dig som vill vara med på vår tillväxtresa inom Test & QA. Hos oss får du möjligheten att arbeta med avancerade tekniska lösningar och vara en del av att forma framtidens system. Välkommen till ett företag där vi satsar på kvalitet och innovation med människan i centrum.



**Om oss**



Vi är inte som alla andra. Vi är Sigma Industry East North – en del av en prisbelönt koncern med hjärtat på rätt ställe och siktet inställt på både roligheter och kvalitet. Med utmärkelser som en av Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare och "Best Managed Company" har vi startat ett helt nytt dotterbolag, Spark, med säte i Liljeholmen, där fokus är system- och mjukvaruutveckling. Hos oss får du möjligheten att vara med och bygga upp ett nytt företag från grunden. Här blir du en viktig del av en spännande resa med intressanta utmaningar och möjligheter.


### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**



Vi söker dig som har en gedigen bakgrund inom Test & Kvalitetssäkring eller mjukvaruutveckling som brinner för kvalitet och har en stark vilja att utveckla både dig själv och andra.



Du är van vid att arbeta i agila projekt, är kommunikativ, lösningsorienterad och trivs i en roll där du får kombinera djup teknisk kompetens med praktiskt ingenjörsarbete.


### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**



**Kompetenskrav:**



* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av test & kvalitetssäkring
* Erfarenhet av att:
	+ Designa, implementera och underhålla automatiserade tester med verktyg som **Selenium**, **Cypress**, **Tosca**, eller liknande.
	+ Bygga testskript i programmeringsspråk som **Java**, **C#**, **Python**, eller **JavaScript**.
	+ Testa och verifiera **RESTful och SOAP API:er** med hjälp av verktyg som exempelvis **Postman** och **SoapUI**
	+ Integrera tester i CI/CD-pipelines med verktyg som **Jenkins**, **Azure DevOps**, eller **GitHub Actions**.
	+ Utföra tester och verifiera data mot databaser som **SQL Server**, **Oracle**, **DB2** eller **Mongo**
	+ Aarbeta med agila metoder som t ex Scrum, Kanban
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


**Meriterande krav:**



* Grundläggande förståelse för säkerhetstestning för att identifiera potentiella sårbarheter, särskilt i system som hanterar känslig kunddata.
* Erfarenhet av att använda verktyg som **JMeter**, **LoadRunner**, eller **k6** för att mäta och förbättra applikationers prestanda.
* Relevanta certifieringar inom QA-området eller agila arbetssätt

### **WE OFFER**



Här får du vara med och bygga upp något från grunden. Frihet under ansvar är vår grej – du får vara med och forma din roll, dina kollegor och ditt sätt att jobba. Dessutom erbjuder vi en arbetsmiljö med högt i tak, mycket skratt och ständig utveckling. Vi erbjuder även ett gäng fantastiska kollegor som är lika taggade som du, korta beslutsvägar, och spännande projekt som sträcker sig över flera olika branscher – från Fordon, Försvar och Tillverkning till Energi, Medtech, Telekom, Retail och IT.



Vi värdesätter balans mellan arbete och fritid och erbjuder konkurrenskraftiga löner och förmåner, friskvårdsbidrag, samt möjligheter till personlig utveckling för att både kropp och knopp ska må bra.


### **MORE INFORMATION**

  



Mattias Karlsson,  

+46 722044396  

Mattias.h.Karlsson@sigma.se



* #### **POSITION**


Senior QA/Testautomatiserare
* #### **COMPANY**


Sigma Industry Spark
* #### **LOCATION**


Stockholm, Sweden
* #### **COMPETENCE AREA**


Hardware Electronics, Software development embedded systems, System development, Test & Quality, Software development, Digitalisation, Digitalisation
* #### **PUBLICATION DATE**


2025-04-22
* #### **EXPIRATION DATE**


2025-04-30
* #### **CONTACT**


Mattias Karlsson, Mattias.h.Karlsson@sigma.se, +46722044396

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
About Us


At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it.



FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day.
  

  

We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field.



Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?


The Role



Our Platform Delivery and Reliability Services (PDRS) team is on the lookout for a highly skilled DevOps Engineer to take charge of provisioning and maintaining Kubernetes clusters and infrastructure pipelines for both on-prem and cloud deployments.



You'll provision and maintain Kubernetes clusters, maintain infrastructure pipelines and manage our cloud infrastructure, ensuring our applications are always performing at their best. Your expertise in developing scripts and automation tools will streamline operations and reduce manual workflows, making everything run smoothly.



When technical issues arise, you'll be the go-to person for diagnosing and resolving them. Your skills with Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, ArgoCD, Ansible, Terraform, and scripting languages like Python or Groovy will be put to great use.



If you're ready to join us and make a real impact, we want to hear from you!



Main responsibilities:


* Manage and maintain cloud infrastructure and resources to ensure high availability, performance, and security of applications.
* Develop pipelines and automation tools to streamline operations and reduce manual workflows.
* Diagnose and resolve technical issues in development, test, and production environments.
* Work collaboratively with software engineering teams to design and implement CI/CD pipelines and automate deployment processes.

Skills and Requirements


* Proven experience working as a DevOps engineer ( min. 3 years of experience)
* Experience working with:
	+ Containers (Docker)
	+ Container Orchestration (Kubernetes)
	+ CI/CD (Jenkins, ArgoCD)
	+ Proven Automation skills (Ansible)
	+ IaC Tools (Terraform)
	+ Jenkins
	+ Python or other scripting languages
	+ Groovy
	+ Troubleshooting
* Good communication skills with the ability to contribute to team discussion and collaborate with different teams


Ensure that you adhere to the Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) obligations for your role.


* Identify and raise any non-compliance incidents promptly to your line manager.
* Challenge processes, policies and projects that will negatively impact compliance within the Group.
* Complete all mandatory compliance training assigned to you.
* Reach out to the Compliance Teams if unsure of any of your compliance obligations or the requirements are unclear.
  


Our Way Of Working


Our world is hybrid.



A career is not a sprint. It’s a marathon. One of the perks of joining us is that we value you as a person first. Our hybrid world allows you to focus on your goals and responsibilities and lets you self-organise to improve your deliveries and get the work done in your own way.


Application Process


We believe talent knows no boundaries. Our hiring process focuses solely on your skills, experience, and potential to contribute to our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and evaluate each candidate based on merit, regardless of personal characteristics as the age, gender, origin, religion, sexual orientation, neurodiversity or disability.

  

Details


**Hybrid**

**Stockholm**

**Full Time Permanent**

FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day.
  

  

We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field.

The Role



Are you passionate about technology and thrive in a fast-paced and technically challenging environment? We are looking for a self-motivated and forward-thinking DevOps Engineer to join our team. If you enjoy staying at the forefront of your craft and are eager to make an impact by driving innovation and reliability, this is your opportunity to shine.



As part of our commitment to delivering high-quality software and systems with speed and reliability, we are looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our DevOps team. This is an exciting opportunity to shape the future of our platform infrastructure, driving automation practices across our CI/CD pipelines and contributing to our broader DevOps culture.

  



Role Overview:



We are seeking a passionate and forward-thinking DevOps Engineer to join our team in a fast-paced, technically challenging environment. In this role, you'll play a crucial part in building a fully automated platform by overseeing Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools, implementing and managing automation, and enhancing our Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) offerings in both on-premises and cloud settings. Your focus will be on streamlining development cycles and reducing time-to-market for customer-facing services through automation, all while adopting a zero-downtime approach to maintain the stability and reliability of our operations. If you're eager to drive innovation and make a significant impact, this is your opportunity to shine.

  



Key Responsibilities:


* Design, implement, and maintain CI/CD pipelines to support fast-paced and high-quality software delivery.
* Build automation for deployments across multiple environments.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate DevOps practices seamlessly into the development lifecycle.
* Enhance platform scalability, reliability, and security in on-premises and cloud environments.
* Advocate for DevOps best practices, promoting a culture of automation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.

* Stay up to date with emerging tools, trends, and technologies, and share knowledge within the team.

* Identify and raise any non-compliance incidents promptly to your line manager.
* Challenge processes, policies and projects that will negatively impact compliance within the Group.
* Complete all mandatory compliance training assigned to you.
* Reach out to the Compliance Teams if unsure of any of your compliance obligations or the requirements are unclear.

  



Skills required:


* Proven experience as a DevOps Engineer or Developer in a fast-paced, technically challenging environment.
* Experience of designing and building reusable CI/CD pipelines using industry standard tools such as Jenkins, Github Actions, Bitbucket Pipelines, TeamCity.
* Experience with container orchestration systems such as Kubernetes and working in a dynamic containerised environment.
* Proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g., Java, Python, JavaScript, Groovy etc.). Having experience with Java and build tools Maven and Gradle is a plus.
* Proficiency with infrastructure as code tools such as Terraform and Cloudformation
* A proactive, problem-solving attitude with a focus on quality, innovation, and collaboration.
* Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to foster partnerships and drive cross-functional alignment

title: Data DevOps Engineer
description:
About Us
  
  

At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it.
  
  

FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day.
  
  

We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field.
  
  

Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?
  
  

As we continue to enhance and scale our platform, we are looking for a motivated DevOps Engineer specializing in Data Technologies to collaborate with our Data Teams. The ideal candidate will have strong hands-on expertise in managing and optimising data infrastructure, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance across all our products.
  
  

This role requires initiative, resourcefulness, and autonomy. The DevOps Engineer should be able to design and deliver end-to-end solutions, diagnose and resolve issues efficiently, and drive a culture of continuous improvement. Additionally, strong communication skills are essential to collaborate with interdisciplinary stakeholders effectively.
  
  

Success in this role also requires proactiveness, adaptability, and the ability to learn quickly when working with complex component integrations. The ideal candidate should be comfortable managing competing priorities, thinking critically, and applying creative problem-solving skills.
  
  

A solid understanding of data science concepts, processes, tools, and infrastructure is essential, along with hands-on experience in AWS.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Design, implement, and manage data infrastructure for scalable and high-performance data pipelines.
  
  

Ownership of the CI/CD pipeline ensuring a stable and performant platform / process.
  
  

Work closely with Data Engineers and Data Scientists to streamline workflows and CI/CD for data products.
  
  

Implement security best practices for data storage, access, and compliance.
  
  

Continuously improve processes and documentation.
  
  

Effective resolution of assigned tickets and tasks.
  
  

Documentation and Knowledge sharing.
  
  

**Technical skills required:**  

Data environments experience (Airflow, EMR, SageMaker, Ray, Tensorflow, MLflow, Kubeflow, Dask, Flink, Flask, Kserver)
  
  

Exposure working with data lakes, data warehouse solutions (Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift)
  
  

Exposure to PostgreSQL, DynamoDB, Kafka, Kafka Streams and Kafka Connect.
  
  

Experience with Openstack, Azure/GCP and AWS. (S3, Lambda, SageMaker, ECS, EKS, EC2, Step functions)
  
  

Ability to write code to automate repeatable processes (Ansible, Python, Bash).
  
  

Experience in using containers and orchestration to dockerize existing applications.
  
  

Experience with docker clustering frameworks like Kubernetes, Docker Swarm.
  
  

Experience in building and maintaining existing pipelines and its components, including, but not limited to, Jenkins, Gitlab, Argocd, SonarQube, Artifactory, Vault.
  
  

Maintain configurations and deployments of software that operates within a highly scalable distributed multi-tenanted environment.
  
  

Understanding of Source Control Management systems like GIT.
  
  

Experience with provisioning tools to treat infrastructure as code, like Terraform.
  
  

Experience with monitoring and APM tools like Prometheus, Kibana, Grafana, Cloudwatch, Loki, OpenTelemetry, Splunk, Elastic.
  
  

**Working conditions:**  

Occasional out of hour's conferencing with overseas colleagues.
  
  

Occasional out of hours or weekend work.
  
  

A workplace that supports & role models Diversity & Inclusion. This is a huge part of who we are and what Kindred stands for.
  
  

Learning & Development to assist you to achieve your career goals.
  
  

Fast-paced agile environment, with leading-edge technology and innovation.
  
  

Work in a collaborative environment with highly talented and motivated colleagues that are passionate about knowledge sharing.
  
  

**Functional Skills:**  

Ability to cope up with competing demands and remain focused on competing priorities.
  
  

Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate with impact.
  
  

Excellent time management and organisational skills.
  
  

Can relate to employees at all levels of the organisation.
  
  

Ability to gain co-operation and commitment.
  
  

People focus
  
  

Our Way Of Working
  
  

Our world is hybrid.
  
  

A career is not a sprint. It’s a marathon. One of the perks of joining us is that we value you as a person first. Our hybrid world allows you to focus on your goals and responsibilities and lets you self-organise to improve your deliveries and get the work done in your own way.
  
  

Application Process
  
  

We believe talent knows no boundaries. Our hiring process focuses solely on your skills, experience, and potential to contribute to our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and evaluate each candidate based on merit, regardless of personal characteristics as the age, gender, origin, religion, sexual orientation, neurodiversity or disability.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
About Us


At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it.



FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day.
  

  

We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field.



Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?

  

The role



We are looking for a passionate and forward-thinking Senior DevOps Engineer to our Platform Delivery and Reliability Services (PDRS) team. If you thrive in a fast-paced and technically challenging environment, we invite you to join our team!



As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you will play a vital role in leading and building a fully automated platform by overseeing the design and maintenance of Kubernetes environments as well as managing Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools.



You will collaborate with development, operations, QA, and cross functional teams to ensure seamless application deployment, scaling, and security across our private and public cloud infrastructure.



Join us and be part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and excellence.

  

Key Responsibilities:


* Lead the design, implementation, and maintenance of CI/CD pipeline tools.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to seamlessly integrate DevOps practices into the development lifecycle.
* Enhance platform scalability, reliability, and security across cloud and on-premises environments.
* Advocate for DevOps best practices, fostering a culture of automation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
* Identify and analyze incidents, develop and implement effective solutions.
* Keep up to date with the latest tools, trends, and technologies, and share knowledge within the team.

  



Skills and Experience:


* Proven experience as a DevOps Engineer or Developer (preferably 5+ years).
* Expertise with IaC tools such as Terraform, Ansible, and Kubernetes Operator.
* Strong Linux administration skills.
* Excellent troubleshooting abilities.
* Experience with programming or scripting languages, such as Python and Groovy.
* Expertise in designing and building reusable CI/CD pipelines using industry-standard tools like Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Bitbucket Pipelines, and TeamCity.
* Experience with container orchestration systems such as Kubernetes and working in dynamic containerized environments.
* Experience with private and public cloud technologies, such as VMware/Openstack, and AWS/GCP/Azure.
* Knowledge of registry and asset management tools such as Artifactory.
* Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to foster partnerships and drive cross-functional alignment.
* Experience and interest in working with AI and AI tools is a plus.

The role
  
  

As we continue to improve our growing platform, we're looking for a motivated DevOps engineer with excellent hands-on and design skills to join our IT team to oversee all aspects of our cloud infrastructure in our multiple offices and locations.
  
  

Initiative, resourcefulness, and autonomy are essential skills for this role. The DevOps engineer should be able to diagnose and resolve problems reliably, lead continuous improvement culture, and have the patience to communicate with a variety of interdisciplinary stakeholders.
  
  

Critical attributes for this role also include proactiveness, ability to quickly learn and pick up complex component integrations, manage many competing priorities and think outside the box. Design simple solutions for complex situations.
  
  

You will know the development life cycle better than the back of your hand including Agile methodologies.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Ownership of the CI/CD pipeline ensuring a stable and performant platform /process.
* Effective communication with Operation's and Development teams.
* Continuously improve processes and documentation.
* Effective resolution of assigned tickets and tasks.
* Documentation and Knowledge sharing.
* Provide end to end solutions including its execution.
* Provide user support to engineering teams.
* Set up tools and required infrastructure.
* Encourage and build automated processes wherever possible.
* Incident management and root cause analysis.
* Follow the company processes, procedures, and methodologies.
* Collaborate to achieve common goals.
* Support and act in line with the company values.
* Keep up to date with compliance training offered by the company.


Ensure that you adhere to the Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) obligations for your role.
  
Identify and raise any non-compliance incidents promptly to your line manager.
  
Challenge processes, policies and projects that will negatively impact compliance within the Group.
  
Complete all mandatory compliance training assigned to you.
  
Reach out to the Compliance Teams if unsure of any of your compliance obligations or the requirements are unclear.
  
  

**Technical skills required:**  

* Design CI/CD pipelines to solve developer's requirements.
* Experience with Android and iOS native apps pipeline, build, test, publishing, etc
* Ability to write code to automate repeatable processes (Ansible, Python, Bash).
* Experience in using containers and orchestration to dockerize existing applications.
* Experience with docker clustering frameworks like Kubernetes, Docker Swarm.
* Experience in building and maintaining existing pipelines and its components, including, but not limited to, Jenkins, SonarQube, NuGet Server, NPM repository, Artifactory, Gitlab, Argocd ...etc.
* Maintain configurations and deployments of software that operates within a highly scalable distributed multi-tenanted environment.
* Understanding of Source Control Management systems like GIT.
* Experience with provisioning tools to treat infrastructure as code, like Terraform.
* Experience with APM tools like App Dynamics, Instana, ability to manage and maintain system configurations.
* Experience with monitoring tools like Prometheus, Kibana, Grafana.
* Exposure to various infrastructure technologies such as Couchbase, Elasticsearch, Oracle, MSSQL, PostgreSQL, and Kafka.
* Exposure to Hyper-V, Openstack, VmWare, RHVE.
* Experience with Azure/GCP and AWS.
* Experience in automation of performance testing.
* Data environments exposure is a plus (Airflow, EMR, SageMaker, Ray, Tensorflow, MLflow, Kubeflow, Dask)


**Working conditions:**  

* Occasional out of hour's conferencing with overseas colleagues.
* Occasional out of hours or weekend work.
* A workplace that supports & role models Diversity & Inclusion. This is a huge part of who we are and what our company stands for.
* Learning & Development to assist you to achieve your career goals.
* Fast-paced agile environment, with leading-edge technology and innovation.
* Work in a collaborative environment with highly talented and motivated colleagues that are passionate about knowledge sharing.


**Functional Skills:**  

* Ability to cope up with competing demands and remain focused on competing priorities.
* Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate with impact.
* Excellent time management and organisational skills.
* Can relate to employees at all levels of the organisation.
* Ability to gain co-operation and commitment.
* People focus.


Our Way Of Working
  
  

Our world is hybrid.
  
  

A career is not a sprint. It’s a marathon. One of the perks of joining us is that we value you as a person first. Our hybrid world allows you to focus on your goals and responsibilities and lets you self-organise to improve your deliveries and get the work done in your own way.
  
  

Application Process
  
  

We believe talent knows no boundaries. Our hiring process focuses solely on your skills, experience, and potential to contribute to our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and evaluate each candidate based on merit, regardless of personal characteristics as the age, gender, origin, religion, sexual orientation, neurodiversity or disability.
