title: Rock engineer to Kiruna mine
description:
We are looking for two Rock Engineers/Bergmekaniker to join the Kiruna Mine’s Rock Engineering team. As mining reaches new depths, your analytical skills, teamwork, and initiative will help tackle the challenges of deep underground mining and contribute to safe, sustainable solutions.


Ort: Kiruna
Anställningsform: Tillsvidare
Ansök senast: 2025-05-18  


**Shaping the future**
----------------------


At LKAB, we are leading the transformation of our industry toward a sustainable future. Just as we aim to reshape the world, we are committed to developing every individual on our team, both personally and professionally. Are you ready to help shape the future of the mining and mineral industry?



**Your role**
-------------


Mining in the Kiruna mine is moving towards greater depths, which brings increased challenges. The Rock Engineering team ensures safe operations and reliable production by identifying hazards and solutions throughout planning and execution. Through close collaboration with planning and operations, the team monitors ground conditions, assesses environmental impact from sublevel caving, and provides forecasts of ground deformation and seismic effects for future planning.Your main responsibilities will include developing and implementing methods to ensure safe and efficient mining operations. Amongst others you will monitor/analyse seismicity, perform damage mapping, develop/evaluate rock reinforcement plans and evaluate/modify mining sequences. Additionally, you will provide operational support by overseeing and managing other rock mechanical challenges. Finally, you will contribute to strategic rock mechanics decisions within the mine.



**What you bring**
------------------


To succeed in this role, you understand the value of collaboration — not just within the team, but across the entire mining operation. You take initiative, turning ideas into action, and aren’t afraid to pick up and drive tasks forward. Your strong analytical skills help you assess situations and identify solutions that are not only technically sound but also relevant and actionable. In a high-paced, operational environment, you stay flexible, shifting focus when priorities change and always keeping the bigger mission in sight.



in addition you bring



* A university degree at Bachelor’s or Master’s level in a field deemed relevant to the position
* At least 5 years of relevant work experience ie being at present already a senior geotechnical engineer preferably working with cave mining methods
* Prior experience in seismic analysis will be viewed favorably
* Experience in project management is regarded as a merit
* Familiarity with mine design and drafting software is considered a valuable asset
* Fluency in English is required. Swedish proficiency is a plus

**What you get**
----------------

* Relocation support for you and your family.
* Excellent conditions for settling in. We guide you through the official procedures necessary to settle in the country if you come from outside Sweden. We also provide temporary accommodation for a reasonable period and help you find a permanent place to live according to your personal needs.
* LKAB helps you learn Swedish, a tool for a better understanding of Swedish culture.
* The Swedish vacation law entitles all employees to five weeks of vacation per year, and four consecutive weeks during June, July, or August. Your contract may include extra vacation days.
* Reward program.
* Free access to LKAB’s own gym and our partners’ facilities in Norrbotten.
* Wellness allowance and educational support, along with access to an art association, leisure club, mountain cabins, and family activities.
* Enhanced parental pay with up to 90% of your regular salary for up to six months (after one year of employment).
* Support and assistance in cases of illness or questions about work environment, health, wellness, and rehabilitation.
* Compensation for dental care and protective eyewear, including terminal glasses.
* Opportunity to apply for scholarships for both your and your children’s studies
* Access to our pension and insurance program with favourable rates.

**Additional information**
--------------------------


The application period is open until 18 of may 2025.You will be based in the city of Kiruna situated in Swedish Lapland, above the Arctic Circle. The community of the same name is spread out over vast areas and offer great opportunities for fantastic outdoor activities, such as hunting, fishing, hiking, skiing, ice climbing, etc. See also http://www.kirunalapland.se/en/.For more information about the role, please contact our hiring manager Kim Sunna, kim.sunna@lkab.com 0980-535 64



Union representatives: Unionen, Sakari Alanko, 0980-725 08Akademikerföreningen, Peter Johansson, 0980-718 79Ledarna, Ingegerd Kyrö, 0980-710 50

title: Senior Software Quality Engineer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Jobbeskrivning**

  

* Arbeta under Lead Engineer SW med att säkerställa kvaliteten hos mjukvaran i en av våra produkter.
* Arbeta med krav för produkten.
* Kommunicera med leverantör av mjukvara i Slovenien.
Verifiera leveranser mot kraven.  
* 

  

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**

  

* Erfarenhet av att kravställa och utveckla mjukvara för säkerhetskritiska system, helst inom fordonsbranschen.
* Initiativförmåga och en vilja att se lösningar.
* Erfarenhet av CAN-kommunikation.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med aktuatorer och sensorer, gärna BLDC.
* Goda kunskaper i C-programmering och versionshantering i Git.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta agilt i Jira.
Flytande svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.  
* 

  

  

**Sista ansökningdatum: 05-05-2025** **Om Deploja**  

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

 *Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Manual QA Engineer | ElevateOS
Junior Simulation Engineer – Aerodynamics (Automotive)
description:
### **Junior Simulation Engineer – Aerodynamics (Automotive)**

**Location:** Södertälje **Scope:** Full-time **Start:** August - September **Duration:** 1 - 2 years assignment


Are you ready to accelerate your career in simulation and contribute to cutting-edge vehicle development? We’re now looking for a **social and proactive Junior Simulation Engineer** with a focus on **aerodynamics** to join a **leading company in the automotive industry**, working on future-forward transport solutions.

### **About the Role**


In this role, you’ll support the design and engineering teams with **aerodynamic simulations** to enhance performance, durability, and sustainability. You’ll be part of a team where ideas are welcome and initiative is encouraged. This is not a passive role—you’re expected to **collaborate, contribute, and help shape development decisions.**


Your responsibilities will include:

* Performing simulations using commercial FEM software
* Analyzing and presenting your results in a clear, structured way
* Collaborating closely with designers and engineers
* Supporting method development to improve simulation accuracy and efficiency

### **We’re looking for someone who**

* Has 1–2 years of experience in simulation engineering, preferably within aerodynamics
* Has experience from the automotive or other high-tech industry
* Enjoys taking initiative, working closely with others, and being part of technical discussions
* Holds a degree in mechanical engineering, applied physics, or similar
* Is confident in English – Swedish is not required
* Bonus: experience with tools like **Abaqus**, **Hypermesh**, or Python scripting

### **About the Assignment**


This is a long-term consulting assignment at the forefront of the automotive industry. You will be employed by **WeQuel**, a people-first consultancy built on equality, trust, and collaboration. We offer more than just assignments – we build **long-term careers and communities** for consultants who want to grow.

title: Software Quality Engineer
description:
### **Software Quality Engineer – med fokus på mjukvarukvalitet och verifiering**


Vi söker en noggrann och tekniskt kunnig Software Quality Engineer för ett långsiktigt uppdrag inom mjukvarukvalitet. Uppdraget innebär att stödja kundens kvalitetsarbete kring programvara i säkerhetskritiska produkter och inleds så snart som möjligt. Rollen är stationerad på plats cirka 3–4 dagar i veckan och tillsättning sker löpande.

### **Om rollen**


I denna roll ansvarar du för att säkerställa att levererad mjukvara håller rätt kvalitet och uppfyller uppsatta krav. Du kommer att arbeta nära vår uppdragsgivare samt ha löpande kontakt med den externa utvecklingspartnern som ansvarar för den faktiska mjukvaruutvecklingen.


Ditt uppdrag är att granska och verifiera deras leveranser, ge konstruktiv återkoppling samt bidra till att arbetsmetodiken följer etablerade standarder för både funktionssäkerhet och cybersäkerhet. Utvecklingsarbetet sker enligt **ASPICE**, med stöd av **ISO 15288** samt **ISO/SAE 21434**.


Observera att rollen inte innefattar egen programmering, utan fokuset ligger på granskning, analys och kvalitetsarbete.

### **Exempel på arbetsuppgifter**

* Stödja Lead Engineer inom mjukvara i kvalitetssäkringen av programvara för en specifik produkt
* Arbeta med kravhantering och spårbarhet
* Följa upp leveranser och säkerställa att dessa motsvarar ställda krav
* Samarbeta och kommunicera med mjukvaruleverantören i Slovenien
* Verifiera mjukvarans funktionalitet och dokumentation

### **Vi söker dig som har:**


Erfarenhet av kravställning och kvalitetsgranskning av mjukvara för **säkerhetskritiska system**, gärna inom **fordonsindustrin**  

Förmåga att ta initiativ och arbeta lösningsorienterat  

Kunskap om **CAN-bussar** och kommunikation i inbyggda system  

Erfarenhet av arbete med **aktuatorer och sensorer**, gärna med **BLDC-motorer**  

God förståelse för **C-programmering** och versionshantering i **Git**  

Vana att arbeta agilt i **Jira**  

Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


Detta är en spännande möjlighet för dig som vill bidra till kvalitet och säkerhet i tekniskt avancerade produkter – och arbeta med etablerade metoder i ett team med höga ambitioner.

**Om Rasulson Consulting**

Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
DP World is growing! We have exciting opportunities for **Solutions Engineers** of all levels to join our ever expanding business across Sweden due to significant growth and contract wins. The primary focus of these roles will be to bring solutions to life for our prospective customers within the Contract Logistics space, analysing customer information and designing a solution fit for purpose for the customer requirement. You will be experienced in the development of concepts for use in formal customer proposals including, but not limited to, process flow diagrams, automation processes and facility layouts in complex cases


These roles will involve periods of significant travel across Sweden and Europewide so flexibility in being able to travel is an essential criteria of this role.


**About the role**

* Responsible for identifying, developing, and nurturing new customers and sales activities with existing customers, which may include beneficial cargo owners, freight
* Design supply chain/contract logistics solutions from large scale (geographical optimization) down to small scale (design of processes and lines/stations) as part of RFQ process
* Work closely with Business Development/Account Management, Launch and Operational teams as part of the solution development process.
* Lead the presenting of technical solutions to customers through proposals, conference calls and presentations in conjunction with account management
* Develop RFQ concepts in to fully detailed designs post award as part of the launch process.
* Actively support and when required lead the delivery of the engineering elements of new business launch including the creation of master data, process validation, infrastructure works, onboarding of plant teams and onsite contractor management.
* Act as interface between regional function and all other areas of the business as required
* Ensure engineering function is aligned with operations team and other support functions during RFQ and launch phase.
* Be able to translate high level operational briefs / objectives in to defined solution proposal and progress and deploy into the live operation
* Contribute to the development and implementation of regional and global initiatives
* Complete new MTM process assessments or update existing processes as required
* Ensure clear and quantifiable data is available to show contribution to business made by individuals and function as a whole
* Act as a “trouble shooter” when required, identify pinch points or problem areas, ensure root cause analysis is completed where appropriate and corrective measures are implemented into operations
* Able to work independently and under own initiative on any site and ensure the delivery of engineering obligations / requirements as dictated by region engineering management and local plant management
* Support in the training and developing of plant-based engineering teams and embed regional standards within sites.
* Complete root cause analysis where appropriate and identify corrective measures
* Be a SME (subject mater expert) on engineering processes, tools and techniques including MTM, autocad, sketchup & excel
* Any activity or function as deemed within the scope and capability of the role in the support of engineering function or operations

**Your Key Skills:**

* Prior experience with working across Solutions Design for 3PL/4PL or Freight Forwarding services
* Ability to communicate effectively across all levels
* Ability to empathise and understand client’s viewpoint and requirements and act as there champion within engineering function
* Ability to interpret data and derive solid conclusions from analysis.
* Highly developed computer skills, including Microsoft Excel (Pivot tables and familiarity with common formulas), Word, Visio or equivalent, and Project Management software are required. Proficient in using AutoCAD to design functional workings of solutions in 3D and 2D formats.
* Project management and operational experience
* Change management skills

**Compensation**

DP World offers exciting and challenging roles within a growing international organization. We strive to hire and develop the right people, locally and globally, stimulating personal growth and self-development within an informal atmosphere. We offer a market competitive compensation package.  



**About DP World**

Trade is the lifeblood of the global economy, creating opportunities and improving the quality of life for people around the world. DP World exists to make the world’s trade flow better, changing what’s possible for the customers and communities we serve globally.


With a dedicated, diverse and professional team of more than 103,000 employees spanning 75 countries on six continents, DP World is pushing trade further and faster towards a seamless supply chain that’s fit for the future.


We’re rapidly transforming and integrating our businesses - Ports and Terminals, Marine Services, Logistics and Technology – and uniting our global infrastructure with local expertise to create stronger, more efficient end-to-end supply chain solutions that can change the way the world trades. The DP World family comprises of syncreon, Imperial and P&O.


What's more, we're reshaping the future by investing in innovation. From intelligent delivery systems to automated warehouse stacking, we’re at the cutting edge of disruptive technology, pushing the sector towards better ways to trade, minimising disruptions from the factory floor to the customer’s door.  



**WE MAKE TRADE FLOW**

**To Change What's Possible For Everyone**

DP World is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO). We strongly believe that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success and we make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We believe that employees are happiest when they’re empowered to be their true, authentic selves. **So, please come as you are. We can’t wait to meet you.**

By submitting your resume and application information, you authorize DP World to transmit and store your information in the world-wide recruitment database, and to circulate that information as necessary for the purpose of evaluating your qualifications for this or other job vacancies

title: Acoustics Engineer
description:
Job Title
Acoustics Engineer
Job Description*Our Audio* *team is expanding, and* *we're**seeking**a**n**Acoustics Engineer* *to help us design and develop* *cutting-edge**audio* *solutions.**Are you as* *enthusiastic**about* *product development and* *audio technology as we are? This is the team for you!*  

Your future team
You will be a part of our audio team and responsible for developing the best audio solutions in the industry. We support product projects in all audio areas acoustics, software, electronics, audio analytics and signal processing. The team is also responsible for Axis audio platform where we constantly develop new features and ideas.  

Your Role:* You will join a small group of acoustics engineers and be responsible for acoustics solutions in hardware projects
* Be part of a broader audio team and contribute to the overall audio solution
* Work as an audio lead in product projects
* Innovate and take care of your own pet projects
  

Who are you?
We’re seeking a passionate individual with a strong interest in product development and a deep enthusiasm for audio technology. You hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in a relevant engineering field—perhaps you're a mechanical engineer drawn to audio systems, or someone with a background in signal processing.
Whether you're a recent graduate or bring years of experience, we’re excited to hear from you.
This role calls for a collaborative team player who thrives in dynamic environments and enjoys working with new people. You should be results-driven, organized, and comfortable managing multiple tasks simultaneously.
Experience in one or more of the following areas is a plus:* Acoustics
* Signal Processing
* Audio Analytics
  

Ready to act?
Do not miss this rare opportunity to be a part of our audio team! If you have any questions please contact me, the recruiting manager, Peter Wahlberg on +46 70170068.
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-05-21*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast

title: 2nd Line Customer Support Engineer
description:
* Fokus i rollen är att hantera ärenden där dina främsta arbetsuppgifter består av att identifiera och prioritera samt lösa olika frågor och problemställningar genom att verifiera, testa och felsöka i Jeeves affärssystem.
* Support, analys, problemsökning och lösning av ärenden inom området Finance.
* Gäller att kunna ta för sig och att driva sin egen kompetens och utveckling framåt. Krävs mycket god samarbetsförmåga, vi jobbar mycket i att lösa problem i gruppnivå.
Responsibilities


* Huvudfokus i rollen handlar om att identifiera och prioritera samt lösa olika frågor och problemställningar från våra kunder genom att verifiera, testa och felsöka i Jeeves ERP inom området Finance.
* Din framgång i denna roll handlar därmed tills stor del om att ha en nyfikenhet och vilja att förstå kundens verksamheten för att kunna supportera dem på bästa sätt.
* Vårt team brinner för att skapa det fulla värdet av Jeeves ERP hos våra kunder. Vi har ett mycket nära samarbete inom gruppen och hjälps åt samt löser problem tillsammans!
* Du kommer även att ha ett tätt samarbete med framför allt vår Produktavdelning, R&D & konsultfunktionen på Jeeves.
* Support, analys, problemsökning och lösning av ärenden inom Supply Chain.
* Gäller att kunna ta för sig och att driva sin egen kompetens och utveckling framåt. Krävs mycket god samarbetsförmåga, vi jobbar mycket i att lösa problem i gruppnivå.
Skills, Knowledge & Expertise


* Verksamhetsserfarenhet inom Finance, samt applikationserafenhet från Jeeves kompenserar utbildning.
* 2-3 års applikationserfarenhet av affärssystem är ett krav. Jeeveskompetens är önskvärd.
* Du har god kunskap inom Finance, erfarenhet från verksamhetsområden inom Finance och är väl insatt i dagliga rutiner och processer inom Finance området
* Arbetserfarenhet och kunna läsa SQL-kod - komplexiteten ligger i att kunna felsöka utifrån SQL, kunna läsa och förstå kod.
* Förstå övriga flöden som gränsar till Finance
* Som person är du en god lyssnare och har en mycket god förmåga att analysera och lösa problem. Du är affärsmässig där du drivs av att leverera god service och med högsta kvalitet.
* På Forterro sätter vi värde på engagemang och nyfikenhet samt prestigelöshet, eftersom vi är övertygade om att det driver utvecklingen framåt både för oss och för våra kunder.
* Du skall vara van vid att arbeta i grupp samt även kunna ta egna initiativ och beslut.
* Du talar och skriver både svenska och engelska flytande.

  

  

Über Forterro


Forterro wurde 2012 gegründet und hat sich zu einem der führenden Anbieter von Industriesoftware entwickelt - mit Niederlassungen in den wichtigsten Produktionsländern Europas sowie regionalen Servicezentren und Entwicklungszentren auf der ganzen Welt. Von mehr als 40 Standorten aus stellen unsere über 1.700 Mitarbeiter Software für mehr als 13.000 Industrieunternehmen bereit und unterstützen diese. Unsere Produkte sind tief in den Anforderungen der jeweiligen Region verwurzelt. Jedes Produkt ist darauf ausgerichtet, die Fähigkeit unserer Kunden zu stärken und zu beschleunigen, effizient zu arbeiten und wettbewerbsfähig zu sein.

**Abteilung**


Support & Education Services


**Beschäftigungsart**


Festanstellung


**Standort**


Schweden, Remote


**Arbeitsplatztyp**


Hybrid

title: Rock engineer to Kiruna mine
description:
**Job Posting End Date / last application date:**  

2025-05-18
  
We are looking for two Rock Engineers/Bergmekaniker to join the Kiruna Mine’s Rock Engineering team. As mining reaches new depths, your analytical skills, teamwork, and initiative will help tackle the challenges of deep underground mining and contribute to safe, sustainable solutions.
  
  

Shaping the future
  
At LKAB, we are leading the transformation of our industry toward a sustainable future. Just as we aim to reshape the world, we are committed to developing every individual on our team, both personally and professionally. Are you ready to help shape the future of the mining and mineral industry?
  
  

Your role
  
Mining in the Kiruna mine is moving towards greater depths, which brings increased challenges. The Rock Engineering team ensures safe operations and reliable production by identifying hazards and solutions throughout planning and execution. Through close collaboration with planning and operations, the team monitors ground conditions, assesses environmental impact from sublevel caving, and provides forecasts of ground deformation and seismic effects for future planning.
  
Your main responsibilities will include developing and implementing methods to ensure safe and efficient mining operations. Amongst others you will monitor/analyse seismicity, perform damage mapping, develop/evaluate rock reinforcement plans and evaluate/modify mining sequences. Additionally, you will provide operational support by overseeing and managing other rock mechanical challenges. Finally, you will contribute to strategic rock mechanics decisions within the mine.
  
  

What you bring
  
To succeed in this role, you understand the value of collaboration — not just within the team, but across the entire mining operation. You take initiative, turning ideas into action, and aren’t afraid to pick up and drive tasks forward. Your strong analytical skills help you assess situations and identify solutions that are not only technically sound but also relevant and actionable. In a high-paced, operational environment, you stay flexible, shifting focus when priorities change and always keeping the bigger mission in sight.
  
  

in addition you bring
  
A university degree at Bachelor's or Master's level in a field deemed relevant to the position
  
At least 5 years of relevant work experience ie being at present already a senior geotechnical engineer preferably working with cave mining methods
  
Prior experience in seismic analysis will be viewed favorably
  
Experience in project management is regarded as a merit
  
Familiarity with mine design and drafting software is considered a valuable asset
  
Fluency in English is required. Swedish proficiency is a plus
  
  

What you get
  
Relocation support for you and your family.
  
Excellent conditions for settling in. We guide you through the official procedures necessary to settle in the country if you come from outside Sweden. We also provide temporary accommodation for a reasonable period and help you find a permanent place to live according to your personal needs.
  
LKAB helps you learn Swedish, a tool for a better understanding of Swedish culture.
  
The Swedish vacation law entitles all employees to five weeks of vacation per year, and four consecutive weeks during June, July, or August. Your contract may include extra vacation days.
  
Reward program.
  
Free access to LKAB’s own gym and our partners’ facilities in Norrbotten.
  
Wellness allowance and educational support, along with access to an art association, leisure club, mountain cabins, and family activities.
  
Enhanced parental pay with up to 90% of your regular salary for up to six months (after one year of employment).
  
Support and assistance in cases of illness or questions about work environment, health, wellness, and rehabilitation.
  
Compensation for dental care and protective eyewear, including terminal glasses.
  
Opportunity to apply for scholarships for both your and your children’s studies
  
Access to our pension and insurance program with favourable rates.
  
  

Additional information
  
The application period is open until 18 of may 2025.
  
You will be based in the city of Kiruna situated in Swedish Lapland, above the Arctic Circle. The community of the same name is spread out over vast areas and offer great opportunities for fantastic outdoor activities, such as hunting, fishing, hiking, skiing, ice climbing, etc. See also http://www.kirunalapland.se/en/.
  
For more information about the role, please contact our hiring manager Kim Sunna, kim.sunna@lkab.com 0980-535 64
  
  

**Union representatives:**  

Unionen, Sakari Alanko, 0980-725 08
  
Akademikerföreningen, Peter Johansson, 0980-718 79
  
Ledarna, Ingegerd Kyrö, 0980-710 50
  
  

About LKAB
  
LKAB is an international mining and minerals group with northern Sweden as its base and the whole world as its workplace. We lead the way towards carbon-free production and we do it together - in an open, warm and safe work environment with technology and development in focus. We welcome challenges, innovative ideas and initiative, always with equality and diversity in focus.
  
  

Do you work at LKAB today but are interested in a new role?
  
Then we would like you to submit your application via our internal career page. Log in to your Workday account and go to "Jobs Hub", where you can search for all available jobs and send your application.
  
  

Prior to recruitment, LKAB has considered recruitment channels and marketing. We kindly but firmly decline all contact from media marketers, recruitment sites and the like.

title: Optimization Engineer
description:
Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.  

Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies.  

In this role, you will be joining the Optimization team, the brain behind our intelligent freight management platform for electric vehicles. Our team focuses on developing cutting-edge optimization algorithms that empower efficient routing, scheduling, and charging strategies for our electric fleet. We are looking for an enthusiastic, humble, and creative Optimization Engineer who is passionate about applying their skills to revolutionize the transportation industry and contribute to a more sustainable future.
### **What you’ll do**

* Use your algorithmic thinking and mathematical skills to develop creative solutions to hard optimization problems related to electric fleet management.
* Collaborate with software engineers to integrate optimization solutions into our electric fleet management platform.
* Analyze large datasets to identify trends and patterns that can be used to improve optimization models.
* Engage with stakeholders and other teams to gain insights into the current challenges and opportunities for optimization within our freight management platform.

### **Who you are**

* Have experience in algorithm design and optimization
* Experience with relevant optimization concepts/techniques (metaheuristics, MIP, CP, …)
* Enjoy working in a diverse team environment with close collaboration with other engineers and relevant stakeholders
* Are comfortable working with different technologies in a modern tech stack (Java, Go, Python, Microservices, GCP, GRPC, …)
* A passion for sustainability and making a positive impact on the environment.
* Preferred: Familiarity with the transportation and logistics industry


This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. We recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible since selection and interviews are held continually.  

At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. title: Einride Summer Internship 2025 - Sweden
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.
   

  

 Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies.
   

  

 As a Summer Intern at Einride, you'll be joining a top talent team of ambitious, creative, kind-hearted people who challenge conventional thinking, think big, and aim for zero emissions.
   

  

**This Summer we are looking for interns in the following areas:**
* Customer Operations: Operations EMEA includes a central team and four regional teams focused on delivering efficient electric transport solutions. As an intern, you’ll support daily operations, collaborate with carriers and customers, and contribute to planning and central initiatives
* Fleet Strategy & Deployment: Fleet Management & Deployment ensures the smooth operation and timely deployment of new vehicles. As an intern, you'll contribute your skills in data analytics (e.g., SQL) and/or project management to support the team’s efforts
* Solutions EMEA: Solutions EMEA analyzes transport demand to create cost-efficient electrification plans for customers. As an intern, you’ll support cross-functional teams by driving key initiatives, conducting pre-studies, analyzing roadmaps, and researching market conditions
* Team Simulation: Team Simulation builds tools and models to test autonomous vehicles in virtual environments. As an intern you’ll help enable the future of autonomous transport and work on areas like map creation, improving model accuracy, and supporting simulation infrastructure
* Team Remote Operate: Remote Operate focuses on enabling safe and efficient remote operation of autonomous vehicles. As an intern, you'll help with either designing reliable, safety-critical electronic systems or helping systems detect and interpret visuals from images and video
* Team Motion Planning & Control: Team Motion Planning & Control develops the decision-making software that guides our autonomous trucks safely and efficiently. This includes algorithms for pathfinding, speed planning, and collision avoidance using real-time localization and perception data
* Team Perception & Machine Learning: The Perception team processes data from sensors like lidars and radars to understand the vehicle’s surroundings, including road surfaces, obstacles, and their movement. As an intern, you’ll help improve the quality and performance of the software that interprets this sensor data
* Communications: Communications covers both external and internal messaging - from media outreach and social media content to company announcements and employee engagement. As an intern, you’ll help craft key messages, post on social media and contribute to campaigns that connect with audiences inside and out
* CEO Office: Work at the strategic engine room of the company alongside the CEO and leadership team. Combining sharp thinking with hands-on execution, the team drives the company’s most important initiatives and decisions. As an intern, you’ll help drive key initiatives through market research, competitor analysis, and hands-on project work


**Internship requirements:**
* Ongoing university studies in relevant field for the role you are applying for
* At least 1 semester remaining until graduating from your bachelor or master studies
* Fluency in spoken and written English
* Eligible for work in Sweden
* You are based in Stockholm or Gothenburg
* Available for work between June 9th and August 22nd


 The internship will be full time (40 hours per week) during the summer and you will be compensated accordingly. We recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible as selection and interviews are held continuously.
   

  

 At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.

title: Data Engineer with interest in Financial Crime Prevention | SEB, Stockholm
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fuelled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.*
**Join Our Mission Against Financial Crime**
 Would you like to work with a team of highly skilled Software Engineers to build solutions that empower complex investigations? We’re looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join our Financial Crime Prevention team—where data, technology, and purpose align to detect and prevent bad actors.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Data Engineer in the Financial Crime Prevention team, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining new technical capabilities in a smart way to allow us to detect bad actors. Here you will have a chance to make a difference and work with challenging tasks. You will have great opportunities to both develop and take further steps in your career working within a highly collaborative environment.
   

  

**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Experience in large scale Data Engineering projects
* Experience in Streaming technology such as Data Flow
* Experience of batch technology such as Data Proc
* Experience in Schema Registry
* Experience in Infrastructure as Code such as Terraform
* Knowledge in Graph DB is an advantage
* Analytical mindset and ability to solve complex technical problems
* Passion for challenges to drive your personal development and professional growth
* Being a team player open for growth and learning is crucially important for the role


**What We Offer**
* Innovative company at the forefront of technology
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Attractive compensation and benefits
* Work-life balance
* Friendly and welcoming culture


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 30th of April 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact rasmus.hallberg@seb.se
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB here** 
 : www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
****Why This Role Matters****
 Internal Data & Analytics (IDA) is a centralised data function within the Product Development organisation. Our purpose is to facilitate a move to a decentralised data architecture that will put trustworthy, high-quality, and actionable data in the hands of every Funnel employee. We are expected to have a solid understanding of how our business operates, a strong sense of what our organisation needs, and a proactive mindset.
   

  

 Our role spans both building software and serving analytics needs. While this role is officially titled "Analytics Engineer," it encompasses responsibilities that go beyond traditional analytics engineering. Depending on priorities, your focus may shift between data engineering, analytics engineering, and descriptive analytics.
   

  

 We are a relatively new and small team with a lot of room for creativity within our problem space. As part of IDA, you can make a noticeable impact by helping more colleagues leverage analytics in their daily work and driving the data maturity of our organisation forward. Along the way, there will be plenty of opportunities to learn and grow in the fields we operate in—a pursuit we expect and encourage at Funnel.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a team member of IDA, you will operate at the intersection of Data Engineering, Analytics Engineering, and Data Platform Engineering. Your key responsibilities include:
   

  

**Data Engineering**
* Design, develop, and maintain ETL/ELT pipelines to process and integrate data from other teams and systems into our team infrastructure.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define, document, and implement data governance policies, ensuring compliance and quality.


**Data Product Delivery**
* Model the output of our pipelines into quality data assets that are ready for self-serve analytics.
* Act as a technical advisor to teams looking to implement their own data solutions in a federated data ownership model.


**Descriptive Analytics**
* Serve insights and best practices in order to drive adoption of data products and features.


**Platform Development**
* Research and implement modern data engineering best practices (e.g., CI/CD processes, infrastructure as code, quality assurance).
* Maintain and improve our architecture to ensure it is best in class and built to last.
* Develop an efficient infrastructure on AWS that complies with our data security policies and certifications.


**Team Collaboration**
* Be a willing collaborator, identify opportunities to support others, and offer timely help.
* Seek and provide feedback through code reviews, retrospectives, and strategic discussions.
* Learn by doing, share knowledge with others, and try out new things that could grow the team's skillset.
* Promote the team's achievements, engage with our stakeholders, and drive adoption of our products.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Strong SQL skills and experience building and maintaining data pipelines (ETL/ELT) in a cloud-based environment (e.g., GCP, AWS).
* Proficiency in Python for data processing, automation, or API integrations.
* Hands-on experience with modern data stack tools (e.g., dbt, Airflow, or similar).
* Knowledge of data modelling techniques, particularly for analytics and business intelligence.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work across technical and non-technical teams.
* A problem-solving mindset with a passion for delivering actionable insights.
* Fluency in English


**Nice to Have**
* Experience with SaaS metrics, product analytics, or revenue data.
* Familiarity with Data Mesh principles and federated data ownership.
* Understanding of data governance, privacy, and compliance frameworks.
* Knowledge of CI/CD workflows and infrastructure as code for data pipelines.
* Exposure to BI tools like Tableau, Looker, or Power BI.


****What We Offer****
* A position where you can shape the future of data and analytics within our organisation.
* A high level of autonomy and responsibility for those who take initiative.
* A collaborative team environment where your opinion matters.
* A fast-paced environment with lots of opportunities for practical learning.


**What Makes You a Great Match For Funnel**
 This role is designed for individuals who thrive in dynamic, collaborative environments and are excited about building the foundations of a world-class data organisation. Whether your expertise leans toward Data Engineering, Analytics Engineering, or Data Platform Engineering, we believe the breadth of this role will provide ample opportunity to learn, grow, and make an impact.
   

  

 Learn more about how we are developing our product in this blog post by our CTO, Jonas Björk: Building Funnel’s Data Platform for Marketing Analytics.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

 At this time, we can only consider applicants who are already located in
 **Stockholm.**
**Benefits & Perks**
 We offer a competitive salary along with great benefits. → Take a look at our benefits here.
   

  

**Office-first**
 At Funnel, we have an office-first approach, and we work from the office a minimum of four days a week. We have lots of flexibility for when life happens, during the summer, through the holidays however, we avoid having standing remote days.
   

  

**Interview Process**
 We have a 4-step recruitment process for most roles → Get an overview of the steps here.
   

  

**Inclusiveness**
 Research shows that many candidates, especially women and individuals from underrepresented groups, may hesitate to apply for a role unless they meet every requirement. If this role excites you and your skills and experiences align, we strongly encourage you to apply. We’re interested in what you can bring, even if you don’t check every box.
   

  

**About Funnel**
 Funnel is the leading Marketing Intelligence platform that empowers marketers to automatically collect, model, visualize, and analyze data from over 500 marketing platforms—without the need for SQL or scripting.
   

  

 Now equipped with measurement, Funnel combines Marketing Mix Modelling, Multi-Touch Attribution, and Incrementality Testing to triangulate the true effectiveness of marketing efforts and provide smart, data-driven suggestions.
   

  

 Funnel enables a workflow that automates the collection of all the data the customer needs, easy creation and maintenance of a robust data model with the customer's own concepts and metrics, with an AI-powered model for marketing measurement, and beautiful reporting on top.
   

  

 All this without the user having to write a single line of code or even be particularly technical. Our vision is that the people who need data for their decision-making should have the tools to do it themselves - and not be dependent on their technical colleagues.
   

  

 Trusted by more than 2,000 businesses worldwide, including globally recognized brands such as Adidas and Sony, Funnel generated over $50M in ARR in 2023 and continues to feature in the FT 1000 list of Europe’s fastest-growing companies.
   

  

 Since its founding in 2014, Funnel has grown into a global team of over 300 employees, with offices in Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, London, Hamburg, and Sydney.
   

  

 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer
description:
About us:
   

  

 Legora is working to empower lawyers and automate legal work. Our approach is to enable the lawyer of the future: a human-AI lawyer who's an order of magnitude more effective than a team of conventional legal professionals. The human-AI lawyer will iterate at the speed of their judgment, even in the most complex legal scenarios, and will out-smart and out-deliver the best pure AI system.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit that thousands of lawyers use daily at global institutions such as Bird&Bird, Mannheimer Swartling, and Heineken. Backed by $37M in funding from top investors like Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator, Legora is a group of exceptional engineers, lawyers, and doers. Here, you will have infinite room to grow and rethink how truly worthwhile work gets done.
   

  

**The role:**
 As a Fullstack Engineer at Legora you will build, review and ship amazing products helping legal professionals all over the world in their day-to-day job. You’ll get the chance to work across the entire tech stack with clear ownership and autonomy.
   

  

 What you will be doing:
   

  

* Architect and implement features end-to-end for our web platform
* Take ownership of our codebase, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
* Work with technologies such as Python, React, Node.js, AWS, Azure and Kubernetes
* Review code and mentor junior colleagues to support them in their development, making the team even better!
* Drive continuous improvement and challenge us, the industry and yourself


 Who you are:
   

  

* A passionate engineer with several years of experience building great products using cutting-edge technologies
* You feel comfortable working across the entire tech stack, with focus on backend development
* You’re autonomous and take pride in the code you write
* You’re a problem solver who’s not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about software architecture
* Experience in infrastructure and integrations are a big plus


 What’s in it for you:
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, London, and NYC, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Legora with the vision of giving lawyers the tools they deserve.
   

  

 We didn't build Legora for how law is practiced today; we built it for how it should be practiced tomorrow.

title: Optimization Engineer
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.
   

  

 Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies.
   

  

 In this role, you will be joining the Optimization team, the brain behind our intelligent freight management platform for electric vehicles. Our team focuses on developing cutting-edge optimization algorithms that empower efficient routing, scheduling, and charging strategies for our electric fleet. We are looking for an enthusiastic, humble, and creative Optimization Engineer who is passionate about applying their skills to revolutionize the transportation industry and contribute to a more sustainable future.

 At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. title: System Developer - Core Team
description:
RaySearch develops a suite of cancer care software, and we are now looking to add more talented developers to our oncology information system RayCare, specifically to our Core team which is responsible for framework development.
   

  

**About RayCare**
 RayCare is a client-server application that runs on premises at many clinics all over the world. RayCare takes care of and helps clinical staff to coordinate their work at the clinic. For example, workflow management, patient chart details and treatment management. RayCare is an innovative oncology information system (OIS) designed to support the complex challenges of modern oncology clinics. It is developed to streamline workflows in cancer clinics to facilitate efficient care faster to more patients. RayCare is used by all staff at the clinic, e.g., physicians, physicists, treatment planners etc. and is used in all steps of patient care, from registration to radiation treatment at the treatment machine and for treatment follow-up. RayCare is integrated with RayStation and its treatment tools but also with external products and supports communication via HL7 as well as DICOM.
   

  

 In the Core team you will mainly work with developing and improving our mission-critical event sourcing and micro service framework as well as installation and security aspects for the RayCare product.
   

  

 As a part of the Core team, you have the possibility to work with a variety of interesting and challenging tasks together with talented colleagues and contribute to evolving the platform and ensuring that it meets the high requirements on patient safety, robustness and availability.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a core team developer, you will be part of designing and implementing a robust and modern software platform for our oncology information system. We believe you are a hands-on system developer with great problem-solving skills and a meticulous and structured approach. RayCare has high demands on sustainable software development ensuring excellent code quality and maintaining best practices. In your everyday work, you continuously contribute to good overall software design with the goal of achieving a highly structured large scale software product. You are always open to discuss overall design within and between teams, valuing collaboration and your colleagues input to find the best solution for the problem at hand.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You have excellent analytic skills and can identify different components of problems, see connections between them, and understand the impact of various proposed solutions. You take responsibility for your work, ensuring that nothing is overlooked when implementing new functionality. You value collaboration, share knowledge with you team, and take pride in delivering high-quality code that supports the teams’ and organization's goals.
   

  

**Requirements**
* M.Sc. in Computer Science, Engineering physics or equivalent academic degree
* Minimum five years of backend development experience with complex products
* Expertise in C#/.NET
* Proficient with SQL Server
* Experience with client-server based systems
* Knowledge of domain-driven design
* Knowledge of event-sourcing


**Meriting**
* Experience of working in an agile environment
* Experience from the MedTech-industry or other regulated industries
* Experience of framework development of mission critical systems
* Experience from microservice architectures
* Knowledge of CQRS/CQS
* High performance computing (multi-threaded/async software)
* Messaging systems such as RabbitMQ
* Experience with security technologies such as; OpenID Connect, certificates, IdentityServer/OpenIddict


**Our Culture**
 Culture at RaySeach is the driving force behind our organization
 **, where** 
 everything we do is driven by a shared passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our dedication is reflected in our ability
 **to deliver** 
 exceptional results,
 **pay** 
 close attention to detail, and consistently
 **go** 
 the extra mile. Our employees stand out as experts in
 **their** 
 field
 **, driven by** 
 a relentless focus on solving problems
 **-** 
 no matter how complex. At RaySearch, we take pride in
 **leading the way in** 
 cancer treatment, leveraging cutting-edge technology to develop innovative
 **solutions** 
 that make a real difference in patient care.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 At RaySearch, we offer a diverse and inclusive work environment, fostering openness, sincerity, and collaboration. Located in Hagastaden, Stockholm's Life Science Hub, our modern and creative workspace includes an in-house gym, yoga, and social activities like ping pong, table football, and regular after-work events. Our bistro serves a fantastic lunch buffet, and we offer morning- and afternoon-fika every day. Our rooftop terrace also provides a stunning 360-degree view of Stockholm, enhancing the work experience. All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package.
   

  

**Application**
 Please apply to the position through the application form below. We do not accept applications by e-mail. Selection and interviews will be ongoing.
